document_data.name: ''Rigid-Quik Cordial''
document_data.mainbody: '''''Rigid-Quik Cordial''''' was a medicinal [[potion]] concocted and sold by [[Derryth Bonecloak|Derryth]] and [[Baelen Bonecloak]] of [[Bonecloak's Apothecary]], [[Baldur's Gate]], in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, Lady [[Madeline Whitburn]] of the [[Whitburn]] family of the [[Upper City]], made a discrete purchase of ''Rigid-Quik Cordial'' via her butler, [[Blathers]], to aid Lord [[Whit Whitburn|"Whit" Whitburn]]'s problem of "stiffness". Lady Whitburn used double the recommended dosage, mixing it with a glass of evening [[sherry]] to absolutely no effect. Madeline mailed a complaint letter to the proprietors of Bonecloak's Apothecary demanding money back or an alternative potion that would aid Lord Whitburn. She asked the Bonecloaks to discretely offer an alternative upon Blathers's next visit.
